summary: David S. Morales was a CIA operative with 25 years of service, working in Europe, Latin America, and East Asia. His official personnel file contains biographic information, employment history, and performance evaluations within the CIA. He received foreign awards and decorations, requiring review and approval for retention. He also had an official cover established within the US Army Staff Group under the MAZE unit, starting in July 1971. The documents highlight his long career in the CIA and his involvement in various operations and assignments, as well as the establishment of official cover for him.
significance: The provided documents do not explicitly mention David S. Morales' involvement in the JFK assassination. However, his long career in the CIA, his work in sensitive areas, and the establishment of official cover suggest a significant role in covert operations. Further research would be needed to determine his specific involvement, if any, in the JFK assassination.
